name: Wendler’s Boring But Big — Descending (5x10 Progression)
time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x 30-45s each + 90s-120s rest between = ~22 min total
overview_and_execution: The Boring But Big (BBB) Descending module consists of 5 sets of 10 reps, progressively decreasing weight each set. Recommended percentages are 70%, 60%, 50%, 40%, and 30% of Training Max (TM). Rest between sets is 60–120 seconds. The progression strategy involves increasing the top set weight over cycles. Cycle options include 50-30% in cycle one, 60-40% in cycle two, and 70-30% in cycle three, after which 70% becomes the new baseline. This method builds hypertrophy and work capacity with a controlled progression.
example_application: Week 1: 5x10 @ 70%, 60%, 50%, 40%, 30% TM. Week 2: Increase top set by 5 lbs. Week 3: Progress to next cycle, adjusting weight as needed.
important_notes: Start conservatively to manage fatigue. If 70% TM is too difficult for 10 reps, reduce it slightly. Superset pressing movements with lat work for efficiency. Avoid excessive fatigue in squats and deadlifts; modify if necessary.
